p: In 2002â€“2003 a novel severe form of pneumonia of unknown etiology emerged in Guangdong, China, and was named severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS). After smoldering for several months, the disease then spread rapidly across the world, facilitated by international air travel and a few so-called super-spreaders, with most notable outbreaks in Hong Kong and Toronto, Canada. Twenty-one percent of affected cases were health care workers.
